letters.description: Comprehensive evaluation of current sleep patterns, family dynamics, and developmental milestones.
Audit and adjustment of the physical sleep environment for safety, lighting, and sensory regulation.
Teaching parents to identify biological sleep windows and differentiate between hunger and fatigue signals.
Choosing a developmentally appropriate sleep training technique tailored to the child's temperament.
Guiding the family through the implementation phase with uniform responses and strict routine adherence.
Analyzing sleep logs and progress data to troubleshoot setbacks and fine-tune the strategy.
Establishing long-term sleep hygiene habits to ensure lasting results and healthy sleep cycles.
